messages.message: I noticed on dogfood, we moved to the yy.ww for the version. Are we moving towards that for all our enterprise customers starting with 22.10?

based on this comment on this ticket (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/RELENG-384?focusedCommentId=42785), it seems that weâ€™ll still use the `release-23.10.0` format to refer to releases for our enterprise customers
or until the code cut for 22.10 it will be the weeks

the UI shows whatever the release version is set as in the `RELEASE_VERSION` environment variable

the environment variable for the biweekly releases so far has been set to YY.WW

i assume that for the enterprise releases, this variable will be set to YY.MM (http://YY.MM)

cc @shiqi

short answer to the original question: dogfood is just using whatever in master branch, we only have one master branch so it can't serve both versioning, but this has nothing to do with the release versioning our customers will see
